Text: DOES ANYONE HAVE THE 1973 SOUNDTRACK VERSION?
Thank you thank you thank you! This is the best version ever.

@lhlavine:

if you mean the exact audio you hear in the film: http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/4605489/Jesus_Christ_Superstar_-_OST_%281973%29__320.rar

For clarity, this is the Original Broadway Cast version which was released on vinyl before the movie was made, with Ian Gillan of Deep Purple singing the part of Jesus; IMHO the best version, but I guess the first one you heard is always the best.  :-)

Mediainfo:
Audio
Format                           : MPEG Audio
Format version                   : Version 1
Format profile                   : Layer 3
Bit rate mode                    : Constant
Bit rate                         : 192 Kbps
Channel(s)                       : 2 channels
Sampling rate                    : 44.1 KHz

Actually, this would be the London version if it starred Ian Gillan (+ Murray Head, Yvonne Elliman).  The original Broadway cast starred Jeff Feinholt and later Teddy Neely (+ Ben Vereen, Yvonne Elliman).

And Bhobson333, I fully agree that the London version outstrips the film soundtrack by far â€” though I do think Carl Anderson was a pretty awesome Judas.

Anyone know if there was one round about 1968?  Someone is looking for one that he thinks Rod Stewart and/or Elton John were on.  He had had an old vinyl LP in the late 60's, but it was played to death!

Is there an even earlier version - about 1967/8?  Someone has asked me to try and find one from then.  He had had an LP with people like Rod Stewart and/or Elton John on it, but it got played to death.  He seemed to think it was released even before they got funding to do the film or musical.
